meanings.definition: Of or relating to the geographical distribution of animals.
meanings.sent1: The zoogeographic patterns in this area show where different animals live.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use zoogeographic data to understand where animals are found around the world.
meanings.sent3: The zoogeographic map looked like a colorful puzzle of animal homes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a zoogeographic map, with each memory representing a different animal habitat.
meanings.sent5: The zoogeographic concept helps us visualize how animals are spread across the globe.

meanings.definition: The study of the geographical distribution of animals.
meanings.sent1: Zoogeographic involves researching where animals live and why.
meanings.sent2: In college, she decided to major in zoogeographic to learn more about animal habitats.
meanings.sent3: The zoogeographic class was so interesting that even the birds outside seemed to listen.
meanings.sent4: His passion for zoogeographic was like a flame that fueled his desire to protect animal habitats.
meanings.sent5: The book on zoogeographic was filled with colorful maps showing animal ranges.

meanings.sent1: The Amazon Rainforest is a famous zoogeographic due to its incredible biodiversity.
meanings.sent2: Explorers were amazed by the variety of species they found in the zoogeographic they had just entered.
meanings.sent3: The zoogeographic region they discovered was like stepping into a wildlife documentary.
meanings.sent4: The zoogeographic boundaries were marked by the types of animals that could be found in each area.
meanings.sent5: Living in a zoogeographic region allows you to experience a wide range of animal encounters.
